definition: stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: If without critical bad news, the index will continue to rise up next week.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有重大利空消息，下周股指延续上行趋势不变。

sentences.english: Asian shares were mixed while U. S. stock futures were pointing to mild gains on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市涨跌互现，美国股指期货开盘后小幅走高。

sentences.english: Even so, the comments sent stocks into a late-afternoon dive.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，此番言论还是令股指在尾盘跳水。

sentences.english: Johnson & Johnson and Merck Sharp & Dohme down the impact of the performance of the Dow to lag behind other indexes.
sentences.chinese: 强生与默沙东下跌影响，道指表现落后于其它股指。

sentences.english: Asian shares lost ground while U.S. stock futures were pointing to a steady open on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市纷纷失守，美国股指期货开盘走稳。

sentences.english: I discuss the function which Index Future downsizes risks of the stock market in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了股指期货对股市风险的防范。

sentences.english: Owning heavyweight stocks will give institutions more control of the index futures.
sentences.chinese: 拥有权重股将增加机构投资者对股指期货的控制力。

sentences.english: The local shares index has dropped sharply towards the 3000 mark.
sentences.chinese: 本地股指骤降，直逼3000点大关。

sentences.english: Stocks have risen from their lows of a week ago.
sentences.chinese: 股指已经从一周前的低点开始上涨。

sentences.english: The red digital in the stock exchange indicates that the stock index has risen slightly.
sentences.chinese: 证券交易所的红盘显示，股指略有上涨。

sentences.english: As the index goes up, there is more and more pressure on cash flows.
sentences.chinese: 随着股指的走高，获利盘的套现压力越来越大。

sentences.english: Major European indexes erased early morning losses.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲几大股指早盘收复失地。

sentences.english: Other major stock indexes also fell heavily.
sentences.chinese: 其他主要股指同样严重下跌。

sentences.english: On the same day, two other major European stock indexes have suffered various magnitudes .
sentences.chinese: 当日，欧洲其他两大主要股指却遭受不同程度的跌幅。

sentences.english: U.S. stock-index futures climbed while Asian shares retreated.
sentences.chinese: 美国股指期货上涨，亚洲股市下滑。

definition: Shanghai Stock Exchange (SSE), abbr. for 上海證券交易所|上海证券交易所[Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
Shanghai composite index (stock market index)
market close
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
blue chip stock
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
to vibrate/to shake/to shudder
to fall/to tumble
(numerical, statistical) index/(math.) exponent/index/exponential (function, growth)
tendency/trend/path
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
short term
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
large fall
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
